gettingstarted.content: Some REST services require authentication. Digital Commerce REST services are authenticated on secure and unsecured channels. This authentication can include the use of the WCToken and WCTrustedToken. To use REST services that require authentication, you must first get authentication data by using a supported identity services. After you obtain the authentication data, you must pass either the WCToken or WCTustedToken parameters, or both, within the HTTP header for every request that requires authentication. If a request is sent over HTTP, pass the WCToken parameter in the HTTP header. Do not pass the WCTrustedToken in HTTP requests, as the parameter value might display. Send both the WCToken and the WCTrustedToken parameters when the request is being sent over HTTPS. The Digital Commerce REST APIs can also use session cookies that are created by the Digital Commerce store runtime for authentication. These cookies allow you to mix requests to the Digital Commerce REST APIs and the Digital Commerce store runtime within the same user session. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/concepts/cwvrestauth.html
gettingstarted.name: Authentication

gettingstarted.content: Digital Commerce REST services support JSON and XML formats for input and output data by default. The default format is JSON. When an XML String is sent to a REST service, you must set Content-Type HTTP header to be "application/xml". The REST service converts the XML input data to the JSON format that is accepted by REST services. Therefore, your input XML format must follow a certain structure so that it can be transformed to the JSON object that is accepted by REST services. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/refs/rwvrestxmlformat.html
gettingstarted.name: Response formats

gettingstarted.content: Preview tokens are encrypted strings that encapsulates a set of preview options and restrictions on when and where the token can be used. Any user who is authorized to access your server and has a preview token, can complete preview actions in the same store for which that token is generated. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.developer.doc/concepts/cpvpreviewtoken.html
gettingstarted.name: Preview tokens

gettingstarted.content: Some Digital Commerce REST services require a request to be sent over HTTPS. Learn more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/concepts/cwvrestsecurity.html
gettingstarted.name: Secure Sockets Layer

info.description:
These services provide APIs related to user and organization management in a B2C and B2B store. Use these classes to:
  • Get person details
  • Add or update a member
  • Register a person as a member
  • Update a member
  • Get or update organization information
  • Lock or unlock an organization
  • Get or update a checkout profile
  • Search for approval records
  • Approve or reject pending approval records
info.title: IBM Digital Commerce Services - User and Organization Management

tags.name: Approval Status
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to approve or reject registrations.

tags.name: Checkout Profile
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get and update a checkout profile.

tags.name: Contact
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get contact details, register a person as a member, and update a member.

tags.name: Person
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get person details, register a member, and update a member.  This class also provides RESTful services used by an administrator to find person information, register new and update existing user information.

tags.name: User Activate
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get activate a user account and resend account activation emails.

address1.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address2.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address3.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

addressType.description: Type of address, valid values are configurable by using a properties file: S (shipto), B (billto), and SB (both shipto and billto). A single address may be of different types. If a properties file cannot be found, a default of SB is used.

administratorFirstName.description: The first name of the administrator.

administratorLastName.description: The last name of the administrator.

administratorMiddleName.description: The middle name of the administrator.

attributeName_storeId_action_sequence.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this user using the following syntax: {attributeName}_{storeId}_{action}_{sequence}: string. The curly braced values must be replaced as follows: attributeName is any attribute specified in MBRATTRVAL table, storeId is the numerical id of the store (or null to indicate all stores), action is either 'r' (for replace) or 'd' (for delete), and sequence to indicate the sequence of this value in relation to other values for this attribute. Some examples. 'JobFunction_10001_r_1' : 'ProductManager' is specifying that the user has a JobFunction attribute value of ProductManager for the store 10001, this is for replacing the first (r_1) JobFunction attribute value for the user. JobFunction_null_d deletes all job functions for the user in all stores.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

businessCategory.description: Describes the kind of business performed by an organization or organizational unit.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.

legalId.description: Registered organization identifier; may be null for an organizational unit.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

orgEntityId.description: The ID for this organization or organizational unit.

orgEntityName.description: The name of the organization or organizational unit.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

phone1Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's primary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

zipCode.description: The ZIP or postal code of the registrant's address.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.member.handler.Org.description: Response of registering an organization entity and a buyer.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.approvalstatus.han.description: Description of approval status record update response.

resultmsg.description: Update approval status message. Possible values include 'approvalsFailed' for a failed approval and 'approvalsOK' for a successful approval.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

logonId.description: The logonId of shopper to reset the password for.

address1.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address2.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address3.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

addressType.description: The purpose of the address. Valid values are: S - shipto, B - billto, SB - shipto and billto (The default value.).

alternateId.description: A special ID assigned by the registrant's business organization or organizational unit to this particular registrant..

attributeName_storeId_action_sequence.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this user using the following syntax: {attributeName}_{storeId}_{action}_{sequence}: string. The curly braced values must be replaced as follows: attributeName is any attribute specified in MBRATTRVAL table, storeId is the numerical id of the store (or null to indicate all stores), action is either 'r' (for replace) or 'd' (for delete), and sequence to indicate the sequence of this value in relation to other values for this attribute. Some examples. 'JobFunction_10001_r_1' : 'ProductManager' is specifying that the user has a JobFunction attribute value of ProductManager for the store 10001, this is for replacing the first (r_1) JobFunction attribute value for the user. JobFunction_null_d deletes all job functions for the user in all stores.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

challengeQuestion.description: Challenge question for verbal confirmation of the customer's identity.

children.description: The number of children the registrant has.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

companyName.description: The company name of the organization that the registrant represents, obtained when filling in demographic information.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth. The format is yyyy-mm-dd, for example: 1980-01-01.

departmentNumber.description: The department identifier for the registrant.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

employeeId.description: The registrant's ID with his or her employer.

employeeType.description: The registrant's status as an employee (for example, regular, permanent, contractor, or part time).

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

household.description: The number of people in the registrant's household; the default is 1.

incomeCurrency.description: The currency in which the registrant's income is paid.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.

logonId.description: The registrant's logon ID. If you are using LDAP, changing a user's logonID is not supported because it would require deleting and recreating the user in LDAP. This process would cause all non-WebSphere Commerce user attributes, such as the password, to be lost. If you are not using LDAP, changing the user's logon ID is not recommended, because the promotion subsystem stores the logon ID of the creator of the promotion in the XMLPARAM column of the PX_PROMOTION table. Note: When the UserRegistrationUpdate command is used to change the logonID, the command will automatically update the USERS.DN database column. Do not assume that ADDRESS.NICKNAME will also change. Instead, the following finder should be used to get the single self address of a user: AddressAccessBean.findSelfAddressByMember(Long memberID).

logonPassword.description: The registrant's password. In database mode, the password is encrypted before it is saved in the database. In LDAP mode, the password is only stored on the LDAP server.

logonPasswordVerify.description: Required if the logonPassword is used: The registrant's password, entered a second time.

manager.description: The name of the registrant's manager.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

mobilePhone1.description: The registrant's mobile phone number used for SMS, for example, 4161235555.

mobilePhone1Country.description: The country code used for the registrant's mobile phone number, for example, CA for Canada.

officeAddress.description: The internal address (for example, mail stop).

orderBefore.description: Whether the registrant has previously placed an order. This value is supplied by the registrant.

organizationId.description: The identifier of the registrant's company.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

organizationUnitId.description: The identifier of the registrant's organizational unit.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

phone1Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's primary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

photo.description: URL or path to a photo of the registrant.

policyAccountId.description: The account policy for this user.

preferredCommunication.description: The preferred phone for the registrant (stored in the ADDRESS table), for example: P1=phone 1 P2=phone 2.

preferredCurrency.description: The registrant's preferred currency for transactions.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

preferredMeasure.description: The registrant's preferred unit of measure.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

receiveEmail.description: Determines whether the registrant wants to receive marketing e-mail activities for the current store (or all stores if no stores have been visited during the session): true - The user wants to receive marketing e-mail activities; false - The user does not want to receive e-mail activities (the default).

receiveSMS.description: Specifies whether the registrant wants to receive marketing SMS messages for the current store (or all stores if no stores have been visited during the session). Valid values are true or false (default).

receiveSMSNotification.description: Indicates whether the user wants to receive order notification SMS text messages. Valid values are true or false (default).

secretary.description: The name of the registrant's secretary or administrative assistant.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the registrant does business (report as GMT +/- hours).

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

userId.description: The user the administrator will update.

userStatus.description: The user account status. A status of 1 indicates the account is enabled, and a status of 0 indicates the account is disabled.

x_demographicField1.description: Customizable field for demographic information; this is single-character field.

x_demographicField2.description: Customizable field for demographic information; this is single-character field.

x_demographicField3.description: Customizable field for demographic information; this is single-character field.

x_demographicField4.description: Customizable field for demographic information; this is single-character field.

x_demographicField5.description: Customizable field for demographic information; a field of 254 characters.

x_demographicField6.description: Customizable field for demographic information; an integer field.

x_demographicField7.description: Customizable field for demographic information; a field var char, length 6.

x_taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

zipCode.description: The ZIP or postal code of the registrant's address.

Empty.description: Empty model. Used as default value when no model is specified.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.member.handler.Org.description: Information about an organization entity identity.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

segmentId.description: The ApprovalGroup identifier for a specific organization.

addAsExplicitInclusionToMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to explicitly add the user too .

addAsExplicitExclusionToMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to explicitly exclude the user from.

removeFromMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to remove the user from.

addAsExplicitExclusionToMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to explicitly exclude the user from.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

addAsExplicitInclusionToMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to explicitly add the user to.

requesttype.description: The request type for example, ajax.

removeFromMemberGroupId.description: MemberGroup Identifiers to remove the user from.

address1.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address2.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address3.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

addressType.description: The purpose of the address. Valid values are: S - shipto, B - billto, SB - shipto and billto (The default value.).

alternateId.description: A special ID assigned by the registrant's business organization or organizational unit to this particular registrant..

attributeName_storeId_action_sequence.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this user using the following syntax: {attributeName}_{storeId}_{action}_{sequence}: string. The curly braced values must be replaced as follows: attributeName is any attribute specified in MBRATTRVAL table, storeId is the numerical id of the store (or null to indicate all stores), action is either 'r' (for replace) or 'd' (for delete), and sequence to indicate the sequence of this value in relation to other values for this attribute. Some examples. 'JobFunction_10001_r_1' : 'ProductManager' is specifying that the user has a JobFunction attribute value of ProductManager for the store 10001, this is for replacing the first (r_1) JobFunction attribute value for the user. JobFunction_null_d deletes all job functions for the user in all stores.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

challengeQuestion.description: Challenge question for verbal confirmation of the customer's identity.

children.description: The number of children the registrant has.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

companyName.description: The company name of the organization that the registrant represents, obtained when filling in demographic information.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth. The format is yyyy-mm-dd, for example: 1980-01-01.

departmentNumber.description: The department identifier for the registrant.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

employeeId.description: The registrant's ID with his or her employer.

employeeType.description: The registrant's status as an employee (for example, regular, permanent, contractor, or part time).

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

household.description: The number of people in the registrant's household; the default is 1.

incomeCurrency.description: The currency in which the registrant's income is paid.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.

logonId.description: The registrant's logon ID. If you are using LDAP, changing a user's logonID is not supported because it would require deleting and recreating the user in LDAP. This process would cause all non-WebSphere Commerce user attributes, such as the password, to be lost. If you are not using LDAP, changing the user's logon ID is not recommended, because the promotion subsystem stores the logon ID of the creator of the promotion in the XMLPARAM column of the PX_PROMOTION table. Note: When the UserRegistrationUpdate command is used to change the logonID, the command will automatically update the USERS.DN database column. Do not assume that ADDRESS.NICKNAME will also change. Instead, the following finder should be used to get the single self address of a user: AddressAccessBean.findSelfAddressByMember(Long memberID).

logonPassword.description: The registrant's password. In database mode, the password is encrypted before it is saved in the database. In LDAP mode, the password is only stored on the LDAP server.

logonPasswordVerify.description: Required if the logonPassword is used: The registrant's password, entered a second time.

manager.description: The name of the registrant's manager.

marketingTrackingConsent.description: The marketing tracking consent. 0 means opt-out, 1 means opt-in.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

mobilePhone1.description: The registrant's mobile phone number used for SMS, for example, 4161235555.

mobilePhone1Country.description: The country code used for the registrant's mobile phone number, for example, CA for Canada.

officeAddress.description: The internal address (for example, mail stop).

orderBefore.description: Whether the registrant has previously placed an order. This value is supplied by the registrant.

organizationDistinguishedName.description: The fully qualified DN of the organization to register under. Required for B2B user registration.

organizationId.description: The identifier of the registrant's company.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

organizationUnitId.description: The identifier of the registrant's organizational unit.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

parentMemberId.description: The parent member identifier of the user.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

phone1Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's primary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

photo.description: URL or path to a photo of the registrant.

policyAccountId.description: The account policy for this user.

preferredCommunication.description: The preferred phone for the registrant (stored in the ADDRESS table), for example: P1=phone 1 P2=phone 2.

preferredCurrency.description: The registrant's preferred currency for transactions.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

preferredMeasure.description: The registrant's preferred unit of measure.

privacyNoticeVersion.description: The version of the privacy notice. For example '1.0'.

profileType.description: The user's profile type. If profileType is not specified, by default, the profileType is set to 'C' and a consumer user will be created; A business user can be by setting profileType to 'B'.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

receiveEmail.description: Determines whether the registrant wants to receive marketing e-mail activities for the current store (or all stores if no stores have been visited during the session): true - The user wants to receive marketing e-mail activities; false - The user does not want to receive e-mail activities (the default).

receiveSMS.description: Specifies whether the registrant wants to receive marketing SMS messages for the current store (or all stores if no stores have been visited during the session). Valid values are true or false (default).

receiveSMSNotification.description: Indicates whether the user wants to receive order notification SMS text messages. Valid values are true or false (default).

secretary.description: The name of the registrant's secretary or administrative assistant.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the registrant does business (report as GMT +/- hours).

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

userStatus.description: The user account status. A status of 1 indicates the account is enabled, and a status of 0 indicates the account is disabled.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.approvalstatus.han.description: Description of the post input body to update an approval status record.

aprv_act.description: Approval status. Valid values are 1 for approve and 2 for reject.

address1.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address2.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address3.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

addressType.description: Type of address, valid values are configurable by using a properties file: S (shipto), B (billto), and SB (both shipto and billto). A single address may be of different types. If a properties file cannot be found, a default of SB is used.

administratorFirstName.description: The first name of the administrator.

administratorLastName.description: The last name of the administrator.

administratorMiddleName.description: The middle name of the administrator.

attributeName_storeId_action_sequence.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this user using the following syntax: {attributeName}_{storeId}_{action}_{sequence}: string. The curly braced values must be replaced as follows: attributeName is any attribute specified in MBRATTRVAL table, storeId is the numerical id of the store (or null to indicate all stores), action is either 'r' (for replace) or 'd' (for delete), and sequence to indicate the sequence of this value in relation to other values for this attribute. Some examples. 'JobFunction_10001_r_1' : 'ProductManager' is specifying that the user has a JobFunction attribute value of ProductManager for the store 10001, this is for replacing the first (r_1) JobFunction attribute value for the user. JobFunction_null_d deletes all job functions for the user in all stores.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

businessCategory.description: Describes the kind of business performed by an organization or organizational unit.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

distinguishedName.description: DN of the organization or organizational unit, for LDAP use.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.

legalId.description: Registered organization identifier; may be null for an organizational unit.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

orgEntityName.description: The name of the organization or organizational unit. Leading and trailing spaces is trimmed. When the system is configured with LDAP, the following characters are not allowed when the orgEntityName is used to construct the distinguished name: 1. The # character occurring at the beginning of orgEntityName. 2. Any of the following characters: = , + " \ < > ;.

orgEntityType.description: The type of the organizational entity being added. O - Organization; OU - Organizational Unit.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

parentMemberId.description: Required if orgEntityType equals 'OU': The member ID of the parent organizational entity where the new organizational entity is added. For an organization (orgEntityType=O), this parameter is not mandatory; it defaults to Root Organization.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

phone1Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's primary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

zipCode.description: The ZIP or postal code of the registrant's address.

logonId.description: The logon ID of the user.

addressId.description: The address identifier of the user.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.member.handler.Org.description: Information about an organization entity identity.

addressId.description: The address identifier of the organization entity.

taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.member.handler.Org.description: Information about an organization entity identity.

addressId.description: The address identifier of the organization entity.

addressType.description: Type of address, valid values are configurable by using a properties file: S (shipto), B (billto), and SB (both shipto and billto). A single address may be of different types. If a properties file cannot be found, a default of SB is used.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

orgEntityName.description: The name of the organization or organizational unit. Leading and trailing spaces is trimmed. When the system is configured with LDAP, the following characters are not allowed when the orgEntityName is used to construct the distinguished name: 1. The # character occurring at the beginning of orgEntityName. 2. Any of the following characters: = , + " \ < > ;.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

customMemberAttributes.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this organization using the following syntax: &attributeName_storeId_action_number=value.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

distinguishedName.description: DN of the organization or organizational unit, for LDAP use.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

administratorMiddleName.description: The middle name of the administrator.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

administratorLastName.description: The last name of the administrator.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

phone1Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's primary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

URL.description: The URL to call when the command completes successfully.

address1.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address2.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

address3.description: The registrant's street address, to a maximum of three lines of information.

zipCode.description: The ZIP or postal code of the registrant's address.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

businessCategory.description: Describes the kind of business performed by an organization or organizational unit.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

parentMemberId.description: Required if orgEntityType equals 'OU': The member ID of the parent organizational entity where the new organizational entity is added. For an organization (orgEntityType=O), this parameter is not mandatory; it defaults to Root Organization.

administratorFirstName.description: The first name of the administrator.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.

orgEntityType.description: The type of the organizational entity being added. O - Organization; OU - Organizational Unit.

legalId.description: Registered organization identifier; may be null for an organizational unit.

addressType.description: Type of address, valid values are configurable by using a properties file: S (shipto), B (billto), and SB (both shipto and billto). A single address may be of different types. If a properties file cannot be found, a default of SB is used.

personTitle.description: The title of the user whose address is being entered (for example, Dr., Rev., Mr. or Ms.).

orgEntityName.description: The name of the organization or organizational unit.

billingCodeType.description: Code designating the method of code structure used for the billing code. The default value is D, assigned by buyer.

orgEntityId.description: The ID for this organization or organizational unit.

customMemberAttributes.description: You can manage custom member attributes (MBRATTRVAL table) for this organization using the following syntax: &attributeName_storeId_action_number=value.

email2.description: The registrant's secondary e-mail or Web address.

email1.description: The registrant's primary e-mail or Web address.

city.description: The name of the city where the registrant resides.

administratorMiddleName.description: The middle name of the administrator.

middleName.description: The middle name of the registrant.

administratorLastName.description: The last name of the administrator.

state.description: The name of the state, province, or equivalent where the registrant resides.

phone2Type.description: The type of phone used for the registrant's secondary phone number, for example TTY for hearing impaired, PCM for pulse-coded modulation, or CEL for mobile. This is a field of 3 characters.

publishPhone2.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's secondary phone number is unlisted.

taxPayerId.description: A string used to identify the user for taxation purposes.

zipCode.description: The ZIP or postal code of the registrant's address.

packageSuppression.description: 1 - An indicator to include package inserts when the order is shipped; 0 - An indicator to not include package inserts when the order is shipped. There is no default for this field. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

bestCallingTime.description: D - An indicator that daytime is the best time to call the registrant; E - An indicator that evening is the best time to call the registrant.

taxGeoCode.description: A tax code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

publishPhone1.description: 1 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is listed; 0 - An indicator that the registrant's primary phone number is unlisted. There is no default for these publishPhone fields. If the field is left unused, it remains null in the database.

organizationUnitName.description: The name of the unit within the organization that the registrant represents.

firstName.description: The first name of the registrant.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the registrant represents.

businessCategory.description: Describes the kind of business performed by an organization or organizational unit.

preferredDelivery.description: The registrant's preferred mode of delivery.

shippingGeoCode.description: A shipping code based on geographical region, especially useful with tax software.

country.description: The name of the country or region where the registrant resides.

administratorFirstName.description: The first name of the administrator.

billingCode.description: The registrant's organization's code to identify the shipping or billing addresses and cost center.

lastName.description: Required if the authentication mode is LDAP: The last name of the registrant. If the authentication mode is LDAP, this parameter is mandatory.
